turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: My StellarWave 5000 coffee maker is completely dead. I plugged it in this morning, and nothing. No lights, no sound, nada! I've tried different outlets, too. What's going on?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you for contacting StellarWave support. I understand your StellarWave 5000 coffee maker is not powering on. To begin troubleshooting, could you please confirm the model number and the date of purchase? This information helps us access relevant warranty details.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ugh, seriously? Okay, hold on... model number is SW-5000 (duh!), and I bought it... uh... June 12th, 2023. Is this going to take forever? I need my coffee!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. According to our records, your device is still under warranty. Please ensure the power cord is firmly plugged into both the coffee maker and the wall outlet. Also, try holding down the power button for 10 seconds to reset the device. Let me know if that helps.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I already told you I tried different outlets! And holding the power button? That's the first thing I did! Is there ANYTHING else? It's like you guys aren't even listening. What about some kind of internal fuse that might have blown?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. While the StellarWave 5000 doesn't have a user-replaceable fuse, it does have an internal thermal cutoff. It's possible this has tripped. To resolve this you will need to unplug the device from the outlet and let it sit for 24 hours to see if it resolves the issue.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Wait, seriously? I have to wait A FULL DAY without coffee because of some 'thermal cutoff' thingamajig? Is there any way to bypass that? Like, can I open it up and reset it manually, or is that going to void the warranty?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your concern. Unfortunately, attempting to open the device will void your warranty. Allowing the thermal cutoff to reset naturally is the recommended first step. If the issue persists after 24 hours, please contact us again, and we will process a warranty replacement. We apologize for the inconvenience.
